de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui

Class OverlayGuiArc

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui.OverlayGuiArc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOverlayGuiArc, IPaintable

    public class OverlayGuiArc
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOverlayGuiArc
    Implements the arcs (arrows) of the Petri net.
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static int arrowLineThickness
      The thickness of the arc (the line of the arrow)

      The drawing area used during last invocation of paintElement.
      private IGuiNode startNode
      The predecessor - the node that is the source of this arc

      Note: We need the IGuiNode as source of the arc because the anchor point of the arrow needs to have the same behavior as on the real drawing when the user moves the mouse over the draw panel.

    • Field Detail

      • debug

        private static boolean debug
        Show debug messages?

      • startNode

        private IGuiNode startNode
        The predecessor - the node that is the source of this arc

        Note: We need the IGuiNode as source of the arc because the anchor point of the arrow needs to have the same behavior as on the real drawing when the user moves the mouse over the draw panel.

      • currentEndLocation

        private java.awt.Point currentEndLocation
        The current end location as Point.

        Note: We need a Point as target of the arc because the arrow tip has to point directly towards the mouse position - not towards an anchor point of another node.

      • arrowLineThickness

        static int arrowLineThickness
        The thickness of the arc (the line of the arrow)

        static int arrowTipLength
        Size of the arrow tip

        The drawing area used during last invocation of paintElement.

      • drawArrowLine

        private void drawArrowLine(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                           java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                           java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Draws the line of the arrow from and to the anchors on two IGuiNode.

        Note: IGuiNode provide their anchor for a specified direction via Getter method.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The Graphics2D context
        startAnchor - The location of the anchor at the source node as Point
        endAnchor - The location of the anchor at the target node as Point

      • getArrowHead

        private java.awt.Polygon getArrowHead(java.awt.Point startAnchor,
                                      java.awt.Point endAnchor)
        Returns an arrow head for an arrow that is specified by start point and end point.

        Note: Start point (source) and end point (target) need to be determined by predecessor and successor (GuiPlace or GuiTransition respectively).
        Parameters:
        startAnchor - The source of the arrow
        endAnchor - The target of the arrow (with the arrow head)
        Returns:
        A polygon representing the arrow head

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • calculateMyBounds

        private void calculateMyBounds()
        Calculates the bounds of the shape roughly (using start and end location and the size of the arrow tip).

        Note: The width of the arrow tip (perpendicular to the axis of the arc) is definitely smaller than the length of the arrow tip.
        Example: If the length of the arrow tip is 20, its overall width is approximately 15.
